dmca.title: [ABUSE] Illegal hosting of Lineage 2 files and server
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 2004 3:47 PM
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Illegal hosting of Lineage 2 files and server

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1


Forwarding to Legal for review.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/


This is a forwarded message
From: NCsoft IP Rights <iprights@ncsoft.com>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>
Date: Tuesday, December 7, 2004, 2:53:05 PM
Subject: [ABUSE] Illegal hosting of Lineage 2 files and server

===8<==============Original message text===============
Hello,



Please review the attached PDF for information on network abuses
occurring on your site.



Thank you for your time,

William Leverett

NCsoft Corporation

Austin, Texas

iprights@ncsoft.com


============Text copy of Attached PDF ====================

 
December 7, 2004 
Sent via: e-mail 
 
 
Dear Sir or Madam: 
 
We have recently received information that someone on your network may be hosting or 
disseminating client/server files and/or related information for NCsoft Corporation’s Lineage II: The 
Chaotic Chronicle that has the primary purpose of emulating the Lineage 2 service. Specifically, these 
sales have been seen on http://l2.hsclan.com which resolves to 67.19.61.170 on the ThePlanet.com 
Internet Services, Inc. Additionally, proprietary Lineage 2 server files are being hosted at 
ftp://l2:l2@l2.hsclan.com/L2C1Patch.zip, also on the ThePlanet Internet Services. Further, hsclan.com is 
the actual server address for actually hosting an illegal Lineage 2 private server. This, if true, is being 
done in violation of Federal copyright law.   As you may be aware, this type of activity may represent a 
direct infringement of the copyright law and would be punishable under law. 
 
The consequences of copyright infringement can be severe.  The copyright law allows the copyright 
owner to recover either (1) its actual damages plus all of the infringer’s profits that are attributable to the 
infringement, or (2) statutory damages of up to $100,000 per copyright. The law also provides for the 
seizure and impoundment (a) of all infringing copies, and (b) of the equipment that was used to make the 
infringing copies.  Injunctive relief is routinely awarded to the copyright owner, and the law permits the 
prevailing party to recover its attorney’s fees. 
 
We have contacted you, the Internet Service Provider (ISP) to make you aware of this activity and 
the liability this site are placing upon you.  Many ISPs have agreed to cancel accounts of those violating 
agreements with a third party or copyright infringers and to remove and preserve as evidence any files 
stored on their server owned by a violator or an infringer.   
 
As a result of the above, we require that you immediately do the following: 
 
1. Cease and desist any and all actual or intended hosting or dissemination of client/server files 
and/or or other copyrighted material (collectively, the “Content”); 
2. Disable all websites hosting or disseminating the Content; and 
3. Provide written verification of the above to us within three (3) days of receipt of this letter. 
 
We will be monitoring the above referenced website to see if you are in compliance with the law, the 
end user license agreement and the rules of conduct.  We reserve all of our rights and remedies provided 
by law.  
 
We urge you to give this matter your prompt and serious attention, and we look forward to your 
immediate response.  Please direct your response to William Leverett of NCsoft Corporation by Tuesday, 
December 14, 2004, at iprights@ncsoft.com. If we do not hear from you by that time, we will consider all 
alternatives available in order to protect our rights.  
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Leverett 
NCsoft Corporation 
Austin, Texas 
iprights@ncsoft.com
